conclusion: Basketball dropped from height H, rebounds to height h, air resistance proportional to gravitational force, find velocity ratio.
Forces acting on basketball: Gravity (mg) downward, Air Resistance (lambda mg) opposite to motion.
Air resistance is constant and proportional to gravitational force.
Basketball undergoes descent from height H and ascent to height h.
Basketball shown at height H and h, with hand indicating collision.
Net force during descent is mg(1 - lambda).
Acceleration during descent is g(1 - lambda).
Velocity just before impact is sqrt(2 * g(1 - lambda) * H).
Collision phase involves pre-collision velocity v_impact and post-collision velocity v_rebound.
Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is epsilon = v_rebound / v_impact.
Net force during ascent is -mg(1 + lambda).
Final velocity at height h is zero, leading to v_rebound^2 = 2gh(1 + lambda).
Substitute v_impact into v_rebound equation: v_rebound = epsilon * sqrt(2g(1 - lambda)H).
Equation for epsilon: epsilon^2 * 2g(1 - lambda)H = 2gh(1 + lambda).
